alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Accomack and northern Northampton Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 817 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Exmore, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Nassawadox around 830 PM EDT. Exmore around 835 PM EDT. Willis Wharf around 840 PM EDT. Onley around 850 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Harborton, Melfa, Jamesville, Silver Beach, Wachapreague, Wardtown, Franktown, Accomac, Locustville and Pungoteague. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
